short_summary: Dredging is necessary to maintain safe navigation within Winnipeg Beach harbour.
description: see attached document for more information.
duration_in_months: That the duration of the contract is not specified
full_summary:
# Harbour Dredging Tender Announcement
## Request for Qualifications (RFQ) - PW-22-01010032

### Overview
The Department of Fisheries and Oceans Canada, Small Craft Harbours is issuing a Request for Qualifications (RFQ) for the harbour dredging services at Winnipeg Beach, Manitoba. The contractor(s) selected will be responsible for the dredging of a 1541 square metre area to a depth of 215.00m, approximate volume of 1812 cubic metres and removal of dredged materials off the department's property.

### Procurement Information
* Tender Reference Number: PW-22-01010032
* Amendment Reference: Amendment 1
* Sollicitude Number: 30003604
* Tender Closing Date: Thursday, 2022-10-28T13:00:00
* Solicitation Type: Invitation to Qualify

### Program Requirements
The contractor will be responsible for the following:
* Dredging of the specified area
* Removal and disposal of dredged material off the department's property
* Compliance with relevant health and safety regulations

### Project Details
* Location: Winnipeg Beach, Manitoba
* Expected Project Duration: March 10, 2023

### Qualification Criteria
The contractor must provide:
* Proof of valid business licence
* Proof of adequate insurance coverage
* Proof of previous experience in marine construction

### Evaluation Criteria
The evaluations will be based on the following factors:
* Experience and qualifications
* Technological capabilities
* Human resources
* Quality and delivery
* Health and safety measures

### Funding Information
This contract is funded in accordance with the Government of Canada's Treasury Board Supply Manual.

### Delivery Information
The contract work will commence following the signing of the contract and completion of any necessary documentation.

### Contact Information
For any inquiries or clarifications, please contact:
Kimberly Walker, DFOtenders-soumissionsMPO@dfo-mpo.gc.ca

### Supporting Documents
Please see the attached documents for further details on the project requirements and qualification criteria.
